text: Mold () is a town and community in Flintshire, a county of Wales. It is in the preserved county of Clwyd. In 2011, it had a population of 10,058. It is west of Chester by road, and north-west of Wrexham by road. It is an old town and was first recorded in 1280. Mold is the county town of Flintshire and was the county town of Clwyd from 1974 to 1996. The town's Welsh name means "The Mound of the Tomb/Sepulchre". ==Gallery== File:British_Museum_gold_thing_501594_fh000035.jpg|The Mold cape File:Christmas_Lights_at_Mold_-_geograph.org.uk_-_99828.jpg|Mold High Street File:Clwyd Theatr Cymru - DSCF1199.JPG|Clwyd Theatr Cymru, Mold Category:Towns in Flintshire
title: Mold, Flintshire
